alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 12:16PM EST until December 20 at 5:48AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. Sandy River At Mercer affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sandy River at Mercer. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Extensive flooding in Farmington on Main Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM EST Tuesday was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 03/19/1936. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
